Therefore, since there are no cases in the table where the unemployment rate is 12.9%, the claim that "if the unemployment rate be 12.9%, chenago be the county" isn't supported by the data. There's simply no evidence to validate this statement because such a high unemployment rate doesn't exist in any of the listed counties.

I should also consider if there might be a typo or misunderstanding. Maybe the claim intended to refer to another metric, but based on the given information, it seems clear that 12.9% isn't present.
